meanings.definition: Deprived of the right to vote or other rights
meanings.sent1: The disenfranchised citizens could not participate in the election.
meanings.sent2: She felt disenfranchised when she was not allowed to voice her opinion.
meanings.sent3: The disenfranchised group of friends couldn't decide on a movie to watch.
meanings.sent4: The locked gate symbolized the disenfranchised access to justice.
meanings.sent5: The image of the empty ballot box highlighted the disenfranchised voters.

meanings.definition: Feeling marginalized or excluded from society
meanings.sent1: He looked around the room, feeling disenfranchised and alone.
meanings.sent2: The students who were often ignored by their peers felt disenfranchised.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed sadly, as if it too felt disenfranchised from the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The wilting flower in the garden seemed disenfranchised among the vibrant blooms.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds overhead matched her disenfranchised mood perfectly.
